item.description:
American Humanist Association conference in Cambridge from April 7 to 10. Richard Dawkins, Steven Pinker, Rebecca Goldstein, Steve Wozniak, and many, many others will be there. It will be a great time, and the AHA conference doesn't stop in Boston very often, so please plan on being part of this big event!

WHAT: AHA 70th Anniversary Conference
WHEN: April 7-10, 2011
WHERE: Hyatt Regency Cambridge Hotel on the Charles River, overlooking Boston, Massachusetts

Register online or by phone at 1-800-837-3792 before February 28 to receive a special early bird discount!

See:http://www.americanhumanist.org/What_We_Do/Annual_Conference/2011

 

Thursday, April 7th – Chapter and Celebrant Sessions Registration (Main Lobby) 8:00am-8:00pm AHA Board of Directors Meeting (BU Lounge) 8:30am-10:00am Essays in the Philosophy of Humanism Symposium 9:00am-6:00pm Exhibitors and EvolveFish Humanist Bookstore (Main Lobby) 9:00am-10:00pm How to Host a Regional Conference – Maggie Ardiente 10:00am-11:00am Establishing Child and Adult Education Programs - Bob Bhaerman 11:00am-12:00pm Lunch Break 12:00pm-1:30pm Chapter Leaders Roundtable Discussion – Maggie Ardiente 1:30pm-2:45pm Celebrant Training: Session 1 – Howard Katz 3:00pm-4:15pm Celebrant Training: Session 2 – Howard Katz 4:30pm-5:15pm Dinner Break 6:00pm-7:15pm Freethought Film Festival Movie Screening – Andrea Steele 7:30pm-9:30pm
item.how_to_find_us: We'll be all over the place, but we'll most likely have our GWH nametags...
item.name: 70th Anniversary Conference of the American Humanist Association
